<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Insistent Door Knocker](/Equipment.aspx?ID=511)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Character Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=12) pg. 72 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This dark iron door knocker comes in a variety of shapes, such as a bird clutching a ring in its talons or a gargoyle holding a ring in its mouth. Placing the door knocker on the surface of a door (an Interact action) causes it to attach and remain in place. While in place, the door knocker whispers hints to you while you attempt to unlock the door, granting a +1 item bonus to [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) checks to Pick a Lock. Removing the door knocker from a surface requires you to use an Interact action.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> command, Interact;  **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** You place the door knocker against a wall, floor, or ceiling. The door knocker fuses in place and creates a usable door within the surface. Any creature can move through the door normally, as if the door had always been there. The door can penetrate up to 1 foot of material, so thick material, such as heavy stone walls, can cause this effect to fail, expending its use for the day. A thin layer of metal in a wall, floor, or ceiling also causes the effect to fail. You can use an Interact action to release the door knocker from the surface and return the surface to its previous shape.

</column>
